metadata.synopsis: Cerys is a tiefling ranger who has been out scouting the road ahead for Zevlor/Asharak, trying to find a way through the goblins on the road. She returns just after the attack on the den to discover her leader is dead, and that she'll have to take his place. She seeks player out immediately and forces a dialogue..
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_MAIN_A3. oe readyattackonden4. blow on the horn to start battle5. betray the drow (wside with the tiefling)6. CRT+SHFT+K on Zelvor and Ashrak7. Kill combat (make sure kill everyone)8. go down and up the ladder9. scene will trigger

33.speaker: Cerys
33.text: Beshaba's black bones, I'm too late. You - where's Zevlor?

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Dead. He fell defending the grove.

12.speaker: Cerys
12.text: I find a clear path to the city, you keep everyone alive long enough to use it. That was the plan.

17.speaker: Cerys
17.text: No bloody heroics... But I guess heroics were necessary to survive all of this. Who are you?

19.speaker: Cerys
19.text: The saviour Zevlor mentioned in his last message. Well met.

42.speaker: Cerys
42.text: I found a path to the city - and with those goblins dead, there'll never be a better time to get on it.

39.speaker: Cerys
39.text: But if what Zevlor said of you is true... you have unfinished business out here.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: I do. We'll have to part ways here.

55.speaker: Cerys
55.text: Should you be heading west, be careful.

7.speaker: Cerys
7.text: This new god has a tight grip on Moonrise Towers, and it was a dark place to begin with.

45.speaker: Cerys
45.text: We've another road to walk, and it's past time we were on it. Though... I suppose some thanks is in order.

41.speaker: Cerys
41.text: Here. It's faint thanks compared to what you've done for us, but it's all we have.
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.NodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.

61.speaker: Cerys
61.text: Gods above - that's the druid. Some timing you have, Halsin.

28.speaker: Cerys
28.text: Don't fancy being in Kagha's shoes right now. Reckon he'll be happier to speak to you, though.
28.context: NodeContext: Grimly amused at the reckoning that awaits Kagha when Halsin finds her. Brightening at the thought of how happy Halsin will be to see you

36.speaker: Cerys
36.text: Find us when you're done. We'll join your camp and drink to fallen foes tonight - if you'll have us.

8.speaker: Cerys
8.text: Go on. He'll want to speak to the one who saved his grove, I expect.

16.speaker: Cerys
16.text: My people will join your camp tonight - a farewell, if you'll have us.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I don't have time to celebrate just yet.

25.speaker: Cerys
25.text: Right. Just let me know when you're ready.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: I prefer to keep my affairs to myself, thanks.

47.speaker: Cerys
47.text: As do I. But you've done your part, so I suppose it's time I did mine.

49.speaker: Cerys
49.text: One thing - take care to the west. This new god has a tight grip on Moonrise Towers.

54.speaker: Cerys
54.text: But if what Asharak said of you is true... you have unfinished business out here.

23.speaker: Cerys
23.text: The saviour Asharak mentioned in his last message. Well met.

40.speaker: Cerys
40.text: Fair enough - I can see you've bled for us, so I won't prod any further.

10.speaker: Cerys
10.text: I take it this business of yours won't keep you with us?

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I'd love to stay, but I have more to do out here.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: I prefer not to travel with civilians.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Never mind that. Where were you while we fought for our lives?

1.speaker: Cerys
1.text: The road to Baldur's Gate. Choked with monsters - or it was.

3.speaker: Cerys
3.text: As I was scouting, I found signs of someone clearing them out.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I had business out in the wilds, and no one else was doing anything.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Rotting with the rest of the corpses, I expect.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I lost track of him in the battle.

18.speaker: Cerys
18.text: No point spreading honey on dung - he's dead. Godsdammit, Zevlor.

62.speaker: Cerys
62.text: No point spreading honey on dung - he's dead. Godsdammit, Asharak.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Being judged by Kelemvor as we speak. I hope he's not found wanting.

21.speaker: Cerys
21.text: Trust a priest not to say it plain - he's dead, then. Gods damn it, Zevlor.

52.speaker: Cerys
52.text: Trust a priest not to say it plain - he's dead, then. Godsdammit, Asharak.

53.speaker: Cerys
53.text: Ah - there you are. No, we haven't met - but I know your work.
53.context: NodeContext: Wry, distant - she wants to speak with you but also resents you a little (Though she knows it's unfair)

13.speaker: Cerys
13.text: Came back to report some lunatic had cleared out the goblin leaders - only to find Zevlor'd gone the same way.
13.context: NodeContext: Amused at the irony, but really just covering sadness with grim pragmatism

56.speaker: Cerys
56.text: He was supposed to play chaperone with this lot, not me. But - moaning won't make the road ahead shorter, I suppose.
56.context: NodeContext: Wry, vaguely bitter - as if Zevlor shirked left her with a task she'd rather not have to do.

59.speaker: Cerys
59.text: Here. It's faint thanks compared to what you've done for us, but it's all we have.
59.context: CinematicNodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.NodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.

20.speaker: Cerys
20.text: Great big druid strolled in, too. Halsin - reckon he'll want a word with you. Once he's done with Kagha, anyway. When you're free...
20.context: NodeContext: Grimly amused - she wouldn't want to be in Kagha's shoes as Halsin's going to take her to task for the harm she caused at the grove. The 'when you're done' leads to her mentioning she and her followers will join your camp to celebrate.

26.speaker: Cerys
26.text: Great big druid strolled in, too. Halsin - reckon he'll want a word with you. When you're done...
26.context: NodeContext: Just recalling. The 'when you're done' leads to her suggesting the tieflings join your camp for a celebration

57.speaker: Cerys
57.text: Beshaba's black bones, I'm too late. You - where's Asharak?
